result.markdown: --- title: "English Monarchs Marriages" subtitle: "TidyTuesday 2024-08-20" date: "2024-08-20" author: "gnoblet" categories: [r, ggplot2, tidyverse, history] image: "../R/2024-08-20.svg" --- ## Overview This week's TidyTuesday explored marriage data of English monarchs, analyzing age differences between kings and their consorts over time. The visualization reveals fascinating patterns in royal marriage dynamics from medieval times to the modern era. ## Dataset The dataset contains marriage information for English monarchs including: - King and consort ages at marriage - Year of marriage - Names of monarchs and consorts **Source**: [TidyTuesday English Monarchs Marriages](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master/data/2024/2024-08-20) ## Analysis ### Data Preparation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Get data df <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-08-20/english_monarchs_marriages_df.csv') # Convert variables to numeric df <- dyr$mutate( df, dyr$across( c(king_age, consort_age, year_of_marriage), as.numeric ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There were 3 warnings in `dyr$mutate()`. The first warning was: ℹ In argument: `dyr$across(c(king_age, consort_age, year_of_marriage), as.numeric)`. Caused by warning in `fn()`: ! NAs introduced by coercion ℹ Run `dplyr::last_dplyr_warnings()` to see the 2 remaining warnings. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Calculate age difference (positive = king older, negative = consort older) df <- dyr$mutate(df, age_diff = king_age - consort_age) # Basic statistics older_consorts <- dyr$filter(df, age_diff < 0) |> nrow() total_marriages <- nrow(df) ``` ::: ### Key Statistics ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Get extremes max_diff <- max(df$age_diff, na.rm = TRUE) min_diff <- min(df$age_diff, na.rm = TRUE) max_year <- max(df$year_of_marriage, na.rm = TRUE) min_year <- min(df$year_of_marriage, na.rm = TRUE) # Find specific cases max_case <- df[which.max(df$age_diff), ] min_case <- df[which.min(df$age_diff), ] cat("Marriage Analysis Summary:\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Marriage Analysis Summary: ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("- Total marriages analyzed:", total_marriages, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` - Total marriages analyzed: 83 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("- Marriages where consort was older:", older_consorts, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` - Marriages where consort was older: 8 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("- Time period:", min_year, "to", max_year, "\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` - Time period: 856 to 1947 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("- Largest age gap (king older):", max_diff, "years\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` - Largest age gap (king older): 40 years ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} cat("- Largest age gap (consort older):", abs(min_diff), "years\n") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` - Largest age gap (consort older): 12 years ``` ::: ::: ### Visualization ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gg$ggplot(df) + gg$geom_point( gg$aes( x = year_of_marriage, y = age_diff, color = age_diff, size = abs(age_diff) ) ) + gg$scale_size_area(max_size = 10) + gg$scale_color_gradientn( colors = c("#3d5941", "#f6edbd", "#ca562c"), values = scales::rescale(c(-12, 0, 40)), limits = c(-12, 40) ) + # Annotation for maximum age difference gg$annotate( geom = "text", x = max_case$year_of_marriage + 320, y = max_diff - 3, label = sgr$str_wrap(paste0(max_case$king_name, " was ", abs(max_diff), " years older than consort ", max_case$consort_name, ". "), 35), color = "#ca562c", size = 4.5, hjust = 0.5 ) + gg$annotate( geom = "curve", x = max_case$year_of_marriage + 150, y = max_diff - 3, xend = max_case$year_of_marriage + 25, yend = max_diff - 0.5, color = "#ca562c", arrow = gg$arrow(length = gg$unit(0.01, "npc")), curvature = -0.1 ) + # Annotation for minimum age difference gg$annotate( geom = "text", x = min_case$year_of_marriage - 250, y = min_diff - 3, label = sgr$str_wrap(paste0(min_case$king_name, " was ", abs(min_diff), " years younger than consort ", min_case$consort_name), 30), color = "#3d5941", size = 4.5, hjust = 0.5 ) + gg$annotate( geom = "curve", x = min_case$year_of_marriage - 100, y = min_diff - 3, xend = min_case$year_of_marriage - 10, yend = min_diff - 1, color = "#3d5941", curvature = 0.3, arrow = gg$arrow(length = gg$unit(0.01, "npc")) ) + gg$guides(size = "none") + gg$labs( x = "Year of Marriage", y = "Age Difference (Years)", title = "Marriage Age Differences between English Monarchs and Consorts", subtitle = sgr$str_wrap(paste0("From ", min_year, " to ", max_year, ", Consorts were ", "older", " than the Monarchs for ", "", older_consorts, " marriages."), 75), caption = "Data: TidyTuesday 2024-08-20" ) + gghrbr$theme_ipsum_rc(base_size = 14) + gg$scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(-20, 40, 10), limits = c(-20, 45)) + gg$theme( legend.title = gg$element_blank(), axis.title.y = gg$element_blank(), axis.title.x = gg$element_blank(), axis.text = gg$element_text(size = 13), plot.title = ggt$element_markdown(size = 20), plot.subtitle = ggt$element_markdown(size = 18) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](2024-08-20_files/figure-html/plot-1.png){width=1152} ::: ::: ## Key Insights 1. **Historical Trends**: The visualization shows how marriage patterns changed over centuries of English monarchy. 2. **Age Differences**: Most kings married younger consorts, but there were notable exceptions where consorts were older. 3. **Extreme Cases**: - **Largest gap**: Edward I was 40 years older than Margaret of France - **Reverse gap**: Mary II was 12 years younger than William III 4. **Social Context**: The data reflects changing social norms and political considerations in royal marriages over time. ## Technical Notes - Used diverging color scale to highlight positive vs negative age differences - Point size represents magnitude of age difference - Annotations highlight the most extreme cases - Data spans from 856 to 1947 ## Files - **Source Code**: [`R/2024-08-20.R`](../R/2024-08-20.R) - **Visualization**: [`R/2024-08-20.svg`](../R/2024-08-20.svg)
